column2: Job Brief  Were looking for a PMO Manager as part of our Project Management Office. In this role, you will be responsible for managing teams and ensuring that our projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards. You will also be responsible for developing and implementing project management processes and tools, and for ensuring that these are followed by all Project Managers.   Role & responsibilities     Manage project deliverables and recordkeeping  Evaluate current project processes and create and implement new methods  Support the management and leadership of the company in all project matters, establishing an efficient organizational structure with necessary tools and resources  Establish and update organizational processes, procedures, and systems  Develop metrics and benchmarks  Develop and implement strategies for enhancing project quality and efficiency    Collaborate with team leaders and managers on project-related initiatives, coordinating regularly to review project status, identify issues, work toward resolution, and maintain project plans  Coordinate the management of project resources and resource utilization  Develop and maintain project cost control plans, including identifying and tracking budget variances, and assisting with budget development efforts  Maintain project records, including meeting minutes, activity reports, and meeting agendas  Monitor progress against plans and schedules, identifying problems, and updating project plans as needed  Oversee and manage project communication efforts, including writing and disseminating project communications, conducting regular project status calls, and responding to team members communications  Assist with project proposals, including developing opportunities, developing presentations  Preferred candidate profile     10+ years experience in a PMO role with international companies  Thorough understanding of project management best practices, with continuous improvement as a core value  Experience leading the implementation of large-scale projects  Strong skills with leadership, conflict management, negotiation  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Attendee panel closed  Perks and benefits
column11: Change Management, Project Management, Process Improvement, Financial Management, Stakeholder Management, Quality Management, Strategic Planning

column2: The Program Manager leads a group of programs and has the ultimate responsibility and accountability for the delivery of the value and strategic outcomes of the items in their portfolio. The Program Manager is expected to own the engagement with business sponsors and key stakeholders, optimize their portfolio delivery and ROI. Ensure that inter-program or strategic initiative risks and dependencies are identified and mitigated, manage costs and benefits delivered. Functional reporting will be to the relevant initiative/ program steering groups. This Program Manager role has responsibility for: Building and managing a Portfolio Management Office to effectively track and manage the portfolio of programmes that require reporting into DBs Change Management Governance framework for both Reference Data and KYC Change. Program manage one or many key change initiatives within the Client Data Change Portfolio. For example: Master Data Management Sourcing trusted external data to facilitate the automated maintenance of DBs Client Data records Industry Classification Codes Re-engineer the technology and operational processes to determine the appropriate codes for DBs client base Alignment of Investment Bank, Corporate Bank, Retail Banks and Wealth Client records About Operations Reference Data Services (ORDS) Operations Reference Data Services (ORDS) is responsible for provision of operational support and management of Party (Client), Product, Org and Instrument Reference data to facilitate KYC and enable client business and trading relationships and associated downstream processes including Regulatory and Tax obligations. ORDS is driving the Group Party and Instrument Data Strategy across CIB, the key elements of this strategy are: Providing a single, authorized source of Party (cRDS) & Instrument Data to all areas across CB IB, that contains accurate and complete Party & Instrument Data with full coverage Distributing the common Party & Instrument data elements/attributes across the organization to ensure a single identifier is used front-to-back and there is consistency, alignment and common usage of Party & Instrument data attributes front-to-back Identify and align common Parties, and their associated common attributes, across the Group (CB, IB, CRU & PB) About the Team  The Operations Reference Data Program Management team supports the CBIB Party Data Program for delivering projects related initiatives. Our Program Management team are working with cutting-edge technology to transform the way that we work. You will be tasked to support the programs strategic direction, as well as creating and managing status of the projects. You will also be in charge to support the program director in the co-ordination, planning and control of the project. Youll be working on innovative projects implementing strategic goals set by the organization. You will be working in an agile environment and will be tasked to to support the larger program needs. Our team of experts will be there to coach and support your development to ensure you excel in this role. Enhance your career prospects through exposure to these advanced technologies and tools. Your Key Responsibilities Production of Management reporting to ensure accurate representation of Party Data Program status Delivery of Senior Management reporting for the CLT Program, Global KYC OpCo, etc. to ensure timely and accurate progress updates are available to make effective business decisions Implementation and ongoing management of Clarity across all program workstreams, in conjunction with Technology, in order to improve timeliness and accuracy of reporting and improved compliance with Bank reporting standards Implement RAID methodology for transparent reporting Embedment of Agile methods and ways of working within Operations, in collaboration with Technology, to promote effective execution. Ensuring roles and responsibilities are embedded in Operations and cross-feature team dependencies are identified and managed Initiate and set goals for programs according to the strategic objectives of the organization Plan the programs from start to completion involving deadlines, milestones and processes Devise evaluation strategies to monitor performance and determine the need for improvements Supervise all program and project managers involved to provide feedback and resolve complex problems Discover ways to enhance efficiency and productivity of procedures and people Apply change, risk and resource management principles when needed Read reports prepared by managers to determine progress and issues Ensure program operations and activities adhere to legal guidelines and internal policies Keep senior management informed with detailed and accurate reports or presentations Analysis of large amount of reference data (cRDS) for various operational regulatory upstream vs downstream usage Your Skills and Experience 15+ years of a track record in Global Program Management, Change management, experience in supervising and displays ability to work in virtual global teams and a matrix organization preferably full-spectrum banking groups (retail, corporate, wholesale, investment banking). Experience in project mgmt tools, especially Clarity will be a huge plus Relevant experience in Change Management, Data Analysis and driving large transformation projects. A proven, considerable level of analytical, problem solving and resource planning skills Experience in Data Management, Data Analytics, Business Analysis and Financial Services Strong and well-developed relationship stakeholder management skills Basic knowledge and awareness of (related) business solutions in the marketplace Open minded, able to share information, knowledge and expertise with peers & team members Demonstration of excellent communication and influencing skills Experience in managing Client relationships to drive change PMP, Scrum Master certification Good to have Cross workstream plan and risk, issue and dependency management Production of Executive level reporting to ensure progress is understood and key risks/issue updates are communicated effectively Understanding of Agile ways of working and methods to enable effective partnership with Technology Production of Executive level reporting to ensure progress is understood and key risks/issue updates are communicated effectively Line management experience

column2: Role & responsibilities  :   Manage the end-to-end project lifecycle, ensuring adherence to schedules, milestones, and critical path activities. Provide leadership and direction to programs, keeping the Cross-Functional Team (CFT) focused on delivery milestones and project objectives. Lead, coach, and mentor the team to cultivate a strong pipeline in specific focus areas within Future Mobility programs.  Manage effective communication with customers, improving organizational responsiveness to their requirements. Communicate and manage customer expectations and contractual commitments internally within the business. Develop specialized expertise in power electronics for electric vehicle (EV) applications. Collaborate with EV clients to understand their specific power electronics requirements and tailor solutions to meet their unique needs. Lead efforts to optimize the performance and efficiency of power electronics systems for EV applications.   Facilitate the implementation of program management processes within the E-Mobility division. Ensure that standard program management processes are followed by project teams. Coordinate program management reviews, prepare and publish program metrics and reports to track progress and performance.  Coordinate all risks and requirements of the program, providing regular updates to divisional and group levels. Communicate, coordinate, and consult with Engineering, Sales, and Industrial Engineering departments to ensure alignment and collaboration across functions  Stay ahead of industry trends and technological advancements in future mobility. Foster strategic partnerships and collaborations with key stakeholders in the future mobility ecosystem to accelerate innovation and business growth. Preferred candidate profile:   Electrical / Mechanical/Mechatronics/Electronics Engineer (BE/B.Tech/M.Tech ) from reputed institute and Automotive Industry- Experience: 15 years. Strong background in automotive engineering/manufacturing domain with relevant project and program management experience in handling Power electronics products Possess strong skills in Business Development, Project Management and Commercial Economic Acumen and ability to build acquisition pipeline. Knowledge and experience with strategic negotiation, developing and applying Customer Value Proposition and skilled at Strategic Thinking. Strong stakeholder management experience both locally and globally and comfortable with uncertainty and ambiguity. High competency in leveraging customer insights and data to drive competitive advantages for the business. Kindly apply  ONLY IF YOUR OPEN TO RELCATE TO PUNE.

column2: Purpose/Objective   He/She would be the end-to-end owner of the entire project including Design, Master Planning, Project Planning, project capex, approvals, Execution of entire life cycle of the project till commencement of operations for business.  This position Heads large project of Adani Airport City Side Development consisting of typically mixed-use development ranging from 5 to 8 Mn sft.  (Hotels, Convention Centers, Commercial offices, Retail & Entertainment etc)  Key Responsibilities of Role   - The person would be a leader and captain of the ship integrating cross-functional teams, motivating to deliver with highest quality, speed, safety, compliance, and stakeholder management.  - The position is expected to have high level of experience in Design management, Design Validation, Master Planning for large mixed use development projects.  Preferably knowledge of Architectural Design and Master Planning and capability of overall Project Management.  - Experience of working with repute International & National Design firms is essential.  - The position is expected to have best knowledge on Landscapes, Interiors, Fit outs, Specialized structures like Convention centers etc.  - Expected to manage all aspects of project including but not limited to inception, planning, budgeting, statutory & legal approvals, Management of Consultants, Contractors, Vendors & Suppliers, Complete execution.  - Includes successful execution of project with at most Safety, Quality, Aesthetics, Cost, and timelines.  - Includes Core & Shell, MEP, Finishing, Interiors, Furniture & Furnishing, Equipment, Landscape, Testing, Commissioning etc. , complete.  - Time & schedule management, budget development and control management, internal approvals, external approvals, design management, contracts management, document management & controls, RFP process, Cost Control & Management, Vendor management, Local Management, Relationship Management, Environment Management etc.  Design Management Master Planning, understanding business requirements from Design perspective, Deriving design brief, Design Basis, Developing Concept, Schematic through various repute consultants.  Design Stake Holder management.  Develop team and execute projects Recruit, manage organizational structure.  Position is expected to handle large teams of Contractors, PMCs, Consultants etc.  Expected to Oversee, Track, Monitor, Asses, Alert and resolve all aspects relating to the Project delivery like planning, construction, design, contracts, implementation, statutory, legals & organizational issues.  Completion of projects within stipulated timelines & Cost Oversee, Track, Monitor, Asses, Alert and resolve all aspects relating to the Project delivery like planning, construction, design, contracts, implementation, statutory, legals & organizational issues.  Successful completion of projects with desired quality and safety Establishment of processes and methods, periodical audits and checks, Standardization of measurable quality and safety initiatives. Technical Competencies   Project Management,Contract Management, Project Execution,Design Management ,Stakeholder Management,Quality and Safety Management  Qualifications and Experience   Qualifications - B. Arch / M.  Arch / B E / B Tech Civil from a reputed Institute recognized by UGC.  - MBA /PGDM in Business Management from a Prime Institute.  - Accredited with industry-leading project management certification(s) such as PMP.  Funct Functional Skills - Designs & Detailing - Local rules and regulations, Laws, Byelaws, - Real Estate Project execution and Project management skills .  - Strategic thinker with a knack for identifying risks effectively.  - Self-motivated and passionate individual with an entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to identify growth opportunities for the firm.  - Link City Side projects with the business strategy.  - Manage resource requirements across the portfolio of projects.  - Implement or oversee appropriate project management methodology.  - Mentor a team of Construction managers and establish a project management office focusing on internal initiatives and multiple client-driven programs.  - Identify and drive improvement projects impacting people, processes and tools across different capabilities.  - Develop and maintain an exhaustive project plan for assigned projects.  - Find the critical path to success and clearly define project success criteria.  - Liaise with various stakeholders and process owners to ensure proactive and smooth flow of communication and seamless change management.  - Lead weekly project review calls with both internal and external stakeholders.  - Develop project budgets, track expenditure, and periodically discuss with finance team to ensure total compliance to budget.  - Evaluate project performance by producing detailed periodical reports.  - Develop key performance indicators for progress monitoring & controls.  - Forecast relevant changes to schedule and cost estimates.  - Supervise all Construction activities, Quality, safety providing technical inputs for the methodologies of construction and coordination with site management.  - Delivery of all projects as per Quality and Schedule - Handover all the new facilities to operation team - Build the process to deploy tasks to the team and improve efficiency.  - Ensure consistency in communication of data & information, and - Guide all dept heads for development and implementation and provide a solution driven approach to meet deliverables and project objectives and targets.  - Guide all dept heads for development and implementation and provide a solution driven approach to meet deliverables and project objectives and targets.

column2: Purpose/Objective   Site Head is responsible for the overall management and successful execution of renewable energy projects at the project site.  He shall oversee all aspects of the project, from planning and construction to operation and maintenance, ensuring that the project is completed on time, within budget, and in compliance with safety and environmental regulations.  Key Responsibilities of Role   Project Planning: - Collaborate with the project development team to create a detailed project plan, including timelines, budget, and resource requirements.  - Ensure that all necessary permits and licenses are acquired for project construction and operation.  Construction Management: - Coordinate and supervise construction activities, including site preparation, equipment installation, and commissioning.  - Monitor construction progress, quality, and safety to ensure adherence to project specifications.  Resource Management: - Manage on-site personnel, including contractors and subcontractors, to ensure they work efficiently and safely.  - Procure and manage equipment and materials needed for project execution.  Health, Safety, and Environmental Compliance: - Implement and enforce safety protocols and procedures to prevent accidents and maintain a safe work environment.  - Ensure environmental compliance by monitoring and mitigating any potential environmental impacts.  Quality Assurance: - Oversee quality control and quality assurance processes to ensure the project meets performance and reliability standards.  Budget and Cost Control: - Manage project budgets, tracking expenses, and ensuring cost control throughout the project's lifecycle.  Stakeholder Communication: - Act as the primary point of contact for project stakeholders, including clients, regulatory authorities, and local communities.  - Provide regular updates on project progress and address any concerns or inquiries.  Operation and Maintenance: - Transition of the project from construction to operation phase.  - Oversee ongoing maintenance and performance monitoring to ensure optimal energy production.  Problem-Solving: - Identify and address project issues and challenges, making decisions that optimize project outcomes.  Reporting: Prepare regular reports for senior management, including progress reports, financial updates, and risk assessments. Technical Competencies   Project management ,Project execution ,EHS Adherence,Vendor Management  Qualifications and Experience   - Bachelor's degree in engineering with minimum 18-20 years of experience in Project Execution, Preferably in Energy/Power Sector.  - Experience in the renewable energy sector will be preferred.  - Knowledge of renewable energy technologies and project development processes.  - Strong leadership and team management skills.  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  - Understanding of environmental and safety regulations.  - Proficiency in project management software and tools.
column11: execution, project management, team management, project development, resource, interpersonal skills, construction management, renewable energy, leadership, construction operations, project execution, project management tools, project planning, communication skills, energy

column2: As the Lead for Open Programs, role holder will be responsible for developing, managing, and overseeing a portfolio of open programs aimed at engaging mid-senior professionals from the social sector, for their continuing professional development. You will play a key role in shaping the strategic direction of open programs, building partnerships, and ensuring the successful execution of programs to achieve their objectives and impact. Key Responsibilities Understand the philosophy and approach of Strategic Capacity Building work, its background and contribute towards achieving the 3-year vision and targets Program Development?-        1. Conduct market research and analysis to identify program opportunities, needs, and gaps,         in alignment with Development Management topics        2. Collaborate with internal curriculum & content teams and external partners to design and         develop programs Program Management       - Oversee the day-to-day management and coordination of open programs, including        budgeting, scheduling, logistics, and resource allocation.      - Develop and maintain program timelines, work plans, and performance metrics to ensure       timely and effective program delivery.      - Monitor program progress, track key milestones, and identify risks and issues to be       addressed proactively Marketing & Outreach       - Develop and implement marketing and outreach strategies to promote open programs and        attract participants.      - Create compelling marketing materials, including brochures, flyers, websites, and social       media content.      - Utilize digital marketing tools and platforms to reach target audiences and maximize       program visibility and engagement. Partnership Development      - Identify and cultivate strategic partnerships with organizations, institutions, and individuals       to enhance program impact and reach.      - Negotiate and finalize partnership agreements and MOUs      - Collaborate with partners to co-create and co-deliver program content, activities, and       resources. Stakeholder Engagement:      - Build and maintain strong relationships with program stakeholders, including participants,       sponsors, partners, and vendors.      - Engage with diverse communities and networks to promote program visibility, participation,       and collaboration.      - Facilitate stakeholder meetings, workshops, and events to gather input, feedback, and       support for program initiatives Educational Qualifications and Experience Required Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, etc.). 11-16 years of work experience. Proven experience in program management, project management, or event management, with a focus on open programs or community engagement initiatives. Strong leadership, organizational, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a dynamic and collaborative environment. Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to engage diverse stakeholders and build consensus. Creative thinking, problem-solving abilities, and a passion for driving innovation and positive change through open programs. Experience with marketing, outreach, and digital media tools and platforms preferred. Remuneration for this role will be commensurate with qualifications & experience. To learn more about us and apply, check out isdm.org.in/careers.

column2: The role is a critical engineering role as Project Manager for setting up new capacities in Foods Co-Man sites. The person will be the custodian of the specifications and the design of typical Food manufacturing system (Process / Packaging / Utilities / Infra) in Co-Man operations, with in-depth knowledge of the working/technology of each equipment.          The role is to ensure that all technical advisory support to all the Foods Co-Man sites, for new projects (greenfield & brownfield) Including New Capacity additions of all different product platforms (Hard/soft Extruded collets/Oats/Potato Chips, etc.) and any new Product innovations, etc.            Responsibilities             Provide technical expertise on Food process & packaging technologies.         Lead project for growth/productivity initiatives in Co-Man sites (Greenfield/Brownfield) and execute as per PepsiCo requirements, in line with budget & timelines.         Drive productivity through developing reliable and cost-effective local vendors meeting to PepsiCo requirements for Third party sites.         For CAPEX (by Co-man/ PepsiCo) driven projects:         Engage with Supply Chain team for Co-Man capacity requirements as part of AOP forecast.         Basis the Capacity requirements engage with GP for Co-Man identification.         Lead Site gap assessment/Feasibility study          Lead scoping, design & preparation of CAR.         Support GP & Finance for Engineering inputs for preparing commercial proposals.         Layout finalization         Engage with Co-Man team on No-debate PepsiCo requirements on Process/ Packaging/ Utility/ Infra & other requirements.         Support tendering of process/packaging scope of works & Vendor selection.          Gantt Chart preparation and periodic tracking with cross functional and Co-Man teams         Overall Project governance         Support site team for timely execution of installation & Commissioning         Engage with Ops team for RMPM arrangements for trials.          Conduct Engineering trials and validate as per PepsiCo Product and Pack specifications.         Ensure track of Pre-Operative checklist compliance before commencing commercial production          Support Co-Man team for initial spares & consumables management for smooth start-up             Co-Man site visits on need basis to ensure project execution on time         Internal & External Stakeholder management          CAPEX governance and Lead Co-Man CAPEX PR/Pos         Work along with Controls team on Capitalization of CAPEX items         Own Pep assets in Co-Man locations and Due diligence in idle assets review          Invoice approvals & Support on payment process         Support capability building of New Co-Mans, India Foods         Drive sustainability agenda for scope of initiating/maximizing Renewable Energy utilization in Co-Man sites.         Drive safety agenda for Co-Man by enabling MESS compliance for Pep assets in Co-Man sites         Implement learnings of Co-Man start-ups           Qualifications             Must be technically qualified Mechanical / Chemical /Electrical/Instrumentation Engineer         10+years of Food process/packaging experience within Food/FMCG industry         5+ years Project Management experience; preferably with mid/large scale investments          In depth engineering knowledge of multiple food technologies/platforms (i.e. potato chips, Extrusion, Baked engineered chips), primary/secondary packaging technologies         General knowledge of civil, utilities, water & WWTP technologies.         Strong network with OEM`s.         Ability to work on ACAD technical drawings, Gantt charts and developing URS.         Work with various stakeholders internally and externally like design consultants, Project Management consultants etc and ensure the quality of execution timely within the estimated cost.         Weekly, monthly reporting of the project progress.         Cost ownership         Ability to organize and deliver capability building programs for Co-Man         Hands-on experience with food engineering innovation and sustainability initiatives.         Self-motivated, go-getter, working under pressurised environment.         Experienced in operating roles in supply chain manufacturing.

column2: As the Engineering Project Manager for Vessels (FPSO, FPU, Semi-Submersible, etc) in SBM Offshore, the candidate is responsible for executing the vessel engineering scope of work within schedule and budget.                                  The Vessel Engineering Project Manager works as part of the project management team, all in coordination with the SBM and regional centers.                                  Furthermore, he will work in close cooperation with internal stakeholders such as planning and engineering departments, and he will be responsible for directly managing the engineering discipline leads (ie, Hull Structure, Marine, and Naval Architecture).                                     Furthermore, you will:                                   Broad knowledge of the technical content of the oil and gas project and products like FPSO, FPU, FSO, semi-submersible, etc                                 Ability to work on fast-track projects, projects with technical innovation, complex execution plans, and/or with stringent clients.                                 Define and control the engineering scope of work.                                 Adherence to the project scope, schedule, and budget.                                 Provide input to the overall project EPM for developing the overall project engineering plan (budget and planning of the assigned engineering scope related to the vessel);                                 Take ownership to define and develop scope by understanding and evaluating the project requirements; define the engineering tasks and activities to be performed on the project.                                 Communicate and promote understanding of the scope, project strategy, execution roadmap, constraints, and ways of working with the engineering team.                                 Review and endorse the engineering resource plan prepared by discipline leads for the assigned scope of work in engineering.                                 Coordinate with discipline leads and discipline managers to accurately forecast man-hours and completion dates for deliverables.                                 Systemically monitors the activities and results and interacts with others to ensure delivery on time and in conformance with specifications.                                 Ensure the project team is aware of project requirements and specifications. Set team expectations for quality standards, enforce safety requirements, and deliver a design to meet client expectations, project needs, corporate standards, and industry regulations.                                 Adherence to the management of the change process. Ensure team members follow the management of the change process.                                 Require awareness of interfaces and interactions between engineering disciplines and other functions (construction, supply chain, commissioning, operation).                                  Play an active role in managing the interfaces with the client, vendor, subcontractors, and third-party consultants, and ensure relevant documents are reviewed timely and thoroughly.                                 Organize design reviews and implement the review results.                                 Coordinate package engineering activities.                                 Review and approve technical bid evaluations for the packages related to his or her area of responsibility.                                 Manage and resolve site design queries.                                 Wherever required, advise or implement the latest and most cost-effective solutions in consultation with PMT.                                   Job requirements:                                   B.E / B. Tech/ Engineering School (or Master) with relevant Engineering Discipline Experience (Naval Arch, Hull Structure or Marine Engineering)                                 15+ Years Experience within a demonstrated history of working in the oil gas and shipbuilding industries, managing vessel engineering scope.                                 Good understanding of engineering disciplines as Hull Structure, Marine, and Naval Architecture.                                   Behaviors inter-personal skills - Key points:                                   Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions                                 Set priorities, plans, and organizes own workload.                                 Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.                                 Planning prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organization goals.                                 Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances                                 Effectively building formal and informal relationship networks inside and outside the organization                                 Gaining the confidence trust of others through honest, integrity authenticity

column2: Urgent : Head (Renewable Power :   Project Planning Monitoring & Control) @ Mumbai Our client is an industry leader in clean energy solutions & has over a decade of experience in executing large-scale & complex renewable energy projects.  Solutions cover the gamut of renewable power from solar, wind &  hybrid power , Floating solar power , Battery storage solutions ,  Green Hydrogen also Futuristic technologies. Industry  :  Renewable power industry No. of positions : 1 No  Location : Mumbai Employment Type :  Work from office  Interview Process : 2 Rounds + HR  Education    & Experience B.E./B.Tech. (Electrical) with 15 -22  years of experience PMP Certification will be preferred  Must have monitoring experience of Green Field Projects of minimum 200 MW solar, 50 MW wind farm  Must has exposure of latest monitoring & scheduling tool, like  Primavera / MS Project   etc.  Are you well versed with  Project Management, Scheduling, Cost Control.  Risk Analysis, Opportunity Management, Resource Management, value management , Collaboration &  Control Capabilities ?   Can you  integrate with other enterprise software such as Oracle & SAP's ERP systems?  Must be well versed with project costing & budgeting for solar & wind projects  Mandatory Skills Required :  Project Planning Monitoring & Control, EPC Solar  Job Purpose  Leading the planning of highly complex renewable energy projects across different technologies i.e. Solar,  Wind, Hybrid, Floating etc.  Create robust monitoring systems to exercise better controls over organizational resources & ensure the timely execution of the projects.  Deploy right systems & processes to adhere regulatory & organizational compliances for all project  deliveries. Ensure that there is no project overrun for any resources.  Job Context To execute the projects in different  technologies across India, they need a leader , who can plan minutely, monitor the progress at every moment & establish better control systems for building efficient delivery of the projects. Since the industry  is growing  rapidly, there is a huge demand for trained manpower.  The Head Planning, Monitoring & Control   is expected to lead, motivate & build teams who can ensure the budgetary   adherence, quality & timely delivery with 100% compliance. column2: Manpower Resources India Pvt. Ltd is a leading Executive Search & Selection company, caters to recruitment services in Manufacturing, Infrastructure, Engineering & Healthcare domain. We have been mandated by a large conglomerate into iron and steel for the below mentioned role. Position Name: Head - Projects Oxygen Plant Location:?Angul Experience: 20+ Years Education: M.Tech /B.E. / B.Tech - Mechanical   Job Purpose: The Head Project - Oxygen Plant will be responsible for overseeing the complete lifecycle of the oxygen plant project with a capacity of 600 TPD. This role involves planning, execution, commissioning, and operational handover. The incumbent will lead a multidisciplinary team and ensure that the project is delivered on time, within budget, and meets all quality and safety standards. Job Responsibilities: Project Planning and Management: Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, budgets, resource allocation, and risk management strategies. Coordinate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables. Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of engineers, project managers, and other professionals involved in the project. Provide mentorship and guidance to the project team to achieve project milestones. Design and Engineering: Oversee the design and engineering phases of the project, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Collaborate with external consultants and contractors for specialized engineering services. Procurement and Contract Management: Manage procurement processes for equipment, materials, and services required for the       project. Negotiate and manage contracts with vendors and contractors. Construction and Installation: Supervise the construction and installation activities, ensuring adherence to project specifications and safety standards. Conduct regular site inspections and resolve any issues that arise during the construction       phase. Quality Assurance and Control: Implement quality control measures to ensure the highest standards of construction and operational readiness. Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with project specifications and regulatory requirements. Commissioning and Start-Up: Lead the commissioning and start-up activities of the oxygen plant. Ensure all systems and equipment are tested and operational before the plant becomes fully functional. Health, Safety, and Environmental Compliance: Ensure that all project activities comply with health, safety, and environmental regulations. Promote a culture of safety and environmental responsibility within the project team.

column2: Roles & Responsibilities:  Project Leadership and Strategy:  Provide overall leadership and strategic direction for the project from inception to completion.  Develop and implement comprehensive project plans, including scope, timelines, costs, quality guidelines, and communication plans.  Ensure project milestones are met and adapt project plans based on evolving needs and requirements.  Team Management and Development:  Lead, coach, and motivate project team members, fostering a collaborative and productive work environment.  Delegate tasks and responsibilities to appropriate personnel and ensure that the team has the resources and support needed.  Stakeholder Management:  Act as the primary point of contact for all project stakeholders, including clients, senior management, and external vendors.  Conduct regular meetings and updates with stakeholders to provide progress reports and address any concerns.  Financial and Risk Management:  Oversee the financial aspects of the project, including budgeting, cost tracking, and invoicing.  Identify, assess, and mitigate potential risks that could impact the project's success.  Quality and Compliance:  Ensure project deliverables meet the required quality standards and comply with industry regulations and company policies.  Conduct regular quality checks and coordinate with the quality assurance team to maintain project integrity.  Continuous Improvement:  Evaluate project performance, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing best practices for future projects.  Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements to ensure the project leverages cutting-edge solutions and methodologies.   Qualifications:  Bachelors or Master's degree in Energy/Power/T&D sector.  A minimum of 10 years of experience in project management, with a proven track record of leading large-scale projects.  Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and drive high performance.  Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.  Proficient in project management software and tools (e.g., MS Project, Primavera).  PMP, Prince2, or equivalent project management certification is highly desirable.  Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a meticulous attention to detail. If you are a strategic thinker with exceptional leadership skills and a passion for delivering outstanding projects, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Perks and benefits   Salary: Negotiable(As per Industry Norms) Benefits: EPF, GHI etc.
